body:

by prolix

So, when do we get to visit? Adam texts Crowley about a month in.
Aziraphale reads it over his shoulder as the demon groans, smiles to himself, and goes to make them both tea.

summary: aziraphale with crowley's feet in his lap, smiling absently as he listens to crowley rant on about his day, piping up his...
body:
aziraphale with crowley’s feet in his lap, smiling absently as he listens to crowley rant on about his day, piping up his agreement now and then or leaning forward so Crowley will give him a sip of his glass of wine

throughout, he is delicately and concentratedly painting crowley’s toenails black

body:
Good Omens

Hubby is a massive Pratchett fan but I’ve never really got into it. Read a few of the Discworld books but it’s never grabbed me properly.

Tonight I watched the first 4 episodes of Good Omens with him.

And now I’m shipping Aziraphale/Crowley HARD.

What is this beautiful, disfunctional, UST-riddled, 6,000 year long relationship?? 😍😍

I. AM. IN. LOVE.

Last two eps tomorrow and then I’m going to need AAALLLLLLLL the fic. 😁

reblog.comment:

summary: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a...
body: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a church long enough to do a full monologue at the Nazi spies and save an angel. Did he ever really need to tell Aziraphale he loves him when he did that?

reblog.comment: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a church long enough to do a full monologue at the Nazi spies and save an angel. Did he ever really need to tell Aziraphale he loves him when he did that?

trail.content_raw: Crowley, a demon, went into a church to save Aziraphale. Walking on consecrated ground is dangerous for him, but he went into a church long enough to do a full monologue at the Nazi spies and save an angel. Did he ever really need to tell Aziraphale he loves him when he did that?

summary: Book headcanons!!! Of what good omens boys look like!!! Please!!!
question: Book headcanons!!! Of what good omens boys look like!!! Please!!!
answer:
Oh, of course!!!

Aziraphale is Middle Eastern! That angel is straight-outta the Garden of Eden, and in my opinion he should look it! Dark skin, thick, dark curls, gorgeous dark brown eyes. Expressive eyebrows, good for frowning condescendingly. He changes his appearance just enough to not be caught as an immortal, but not so much that he ever looks strikingly different.

And he’s always chubby! So chubby! Adorably chubby! People invented food, and Aziraphale started enjoying it. But he’s made of cupcakes, heavenly light, and pure, undiluted wrath, so he can absolutely lift an armoured truck, or punch a hole in a brick wall. He just doesn’t want to. It’s not aesthetic enough.

Crowley, canonically, changes his appearance a lot more to fit in with his surroundings. I like to think that when in the Middle East he’s Middle Eastern, when in Ethiopia he’s Ethiopian, when in 17th century Britain he’s British. But with modern multiculturalism he doesn’t have to change his appearance quite so much. So during actual book stuff I always thought of him as Indian. There’s such a great Indian community in London, I want them represented!

But I also think he always has typical Crowley characteristics. The snake eyes, obviously. His bone structure may change, but he always has characteristically high cheek bones. A strong, defined nose. Slightly pointy canines. And he’s always just a little bit too tall. Not tall enough to be noticeable, but just tall enough that his limbs look like they’d be more comfortable coiled up.

Oh, and modern Crowley has an undercut.

And just while I’m here: I think Aziraphale is far more likely to age a corporation slowly over about 100 years (so he’d age from ~25 to ~55 in that time) before shifting his appearance ever so slightly and starting all over again, while Crowley will make himself one corporation that looks anything from 25-40 depending on the lighting, keep it exactly the same while the look’s in fashion, then trash it for something wholly new.

(P.S. it’s not that I don’t think David Tennant and Michael Sheen did an astounding job, they were better than I ever could’ve hoped, it’s just, these have been my boys since I was 12 years old. I’m not about to start reading the book differently because they made a TV show).

summary: Ok but like... When Crowley and Zira sober up... Crowley looks like he's taking a dump and the wine bottles fill back up... So...
body:
Ok but like… When Crowley and Zira sober up… Crowley looks like he’s taking a dump and the wine bottles fill back up… So two questions

  1. Did Crowley shit the wine out?
  2. Are they gonna drink that wine again?

blog.description: tegan / kermit is my government mandated kin / he/him or they/them / pansexual demiboy, but tomorrow is a mystery! / asks are always open! / my commissions are open too / terfs, maps/nomaps, exclusionists and transmed/truscum don't fuckin interact

summary:
my mom: because when they (aziraphale and crowley) talked about “worldly pleasures” there was no talk of sex or women-
me:...
body:
my mom: because when they (aziraphale and crowley) talked about “worldly pleasures” there was no talk of sex or women-

me: that’s because they’re in love with EACH OTHER!!!!
